intro: Rhodosciadium nudicaule, commonly known as the naked-stemmed rhodosciadium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its slender, hairless stems and small, clustered flowers make it a distinctive member of its genus. Rhodosciadium nudicaule is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
